reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7166, 'name': 'Sylvain Bauza', 'email': 'sbauza@redhat.com', 'username': 'sbauza'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14384, 'name': 'Quobyte OpenStack CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci-external@quobyte.com', 'username': 'quobyteci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23498, 'name': 'IBM zVM CI', 'email': 'zvmosci@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'zvmosci'}, {'_account_id': 26515, 'name': 'Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'nova_hyperv_ci@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'nova_hyperv_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-26 21:49:30.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Pass the correct image to build_request_spec in conductor.rebuild_instance

If we're calling build_request_spec in conductor.rebuild_instance,
it's because we are evacuating and the instance is so old it does
not have a request spec. We need the request_spec to pass to the
scheduler to pick a destination host for the evacuation.

For evacuate, nova-api does not pass any image reference parameters,
and even if it did, those are image IDs, not an image meta dict that
build_request_spec expects, so this code has just always been wrong.

This change fixes the problem by passing a primitive version of
the instance.image_meta which build_request_spec will then return
back to conductor and that gets used to build a RequestSpec object
from primitives.

It's important to use the correct image meta so that the scheduler
can properly filter hosts using things like the
AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation and ImagePropertiesFilter filters.

Change-Id: I0c8ce65016287de7be921c312493667a8c7f762e
Closes-Bug: #1727855
"}]
commit_message:
Pass the correct image to build_request_spec in conductor.rebuild_instance

If we're calling build_request_spec in conductor.rebuild_instance,
it's because we are evacuating and the instance is so old it does
not have a request spec. We need the request_spec to pass to the
scheduler to pick a destination host for the evacuation.

For evacuate, nova-api does not pass any image reference parameters,
and even if it did, those are image IDs, not an image meta dict that
build_request_spec expects, so this code has just always been wrong.

This change fixes the problem by passing a primitive version of
the instance.image_meta which build_request_spec will then return
back to conductor and that gets used to build a RequestSpec object
from primitives.

It's important to use the correct image meta so that the scheduler
can properly filter hosts using things like the
AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation and ImagePropertiesFilter filters.

Change-Id: I0c8ce65016287de7be921c312493667a8c7f762e

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-18 01:30:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/objects/db/test_api.py', 'neutron/db/_model_query.py'], 'message': 'Add NULL check before passing to in_() column operator

In some cases we may need to pass key=None filters to get_object()
and get_objects() methods, however we lack of NULL check before these
filters reach in_(), which will not return any matching queries in db
layer.

We need to do manual equals matches if NULL element exists in filters,
instead of pass them to in_() operator.

Change-Id: I7980b82e2627b7b097cae0a714d22e680cddd340
Closes-Bug: #1724177
'}]
commit_message:
Add NULL check before passing to in_() column operator

In some cases we may need to pass key=None filters to get_object()
and get_objects() methods, however we lack of NULL check before these
filters reach in_(), which will not return any matching queries in db
layer.

We need to do manual equals matches if NULL element exists in filters,
instead of pass them to in_() operator.

Change-Id: I7980b82e2627b7b097cae0a714d22e680cddd340
Closes-Bug: #1724177

This feature is no longer supported by the version of Gerrit that we
run. The decision was made to drop the need for contact filing because

commit_message:
Remove Gerrit contact info filing step

This feature is no longer supported by the version of Gerrit that we
run. The decision was made to drop the need for contact filing because
the openstack.org website has an api now to do member lookups and we
don't have to rely on CLA signing in Gerrit for technical election
eligibility.

This coupled with Gerrit dropping support for the feature means we just
don't do it anymore.

Change-Id: I28bee0b5a8e8ed53fedd2369de54504369f5032f

subject: Fix issue with different decimal separators
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 11047, 'name': 'Mark Sturdevant', 'email': 'mark.sturdevant@ibm.com', 'username': 'markstur'}, {'_account_id': 15831, 'name': 'Infortrend CI', 'email': 'ryan.chiang@infortrend.com', 'username': 'InfortrendCI'}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 17780, 'name': 'Dustin Schoenbrun', 'email': 'dschoenb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dschoenb'}, {'_account_id': 18883, 'name': 'IBM Storage CI', 'email': 'IBM_CI@il.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm_storage_ci'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 25243, 'name': 'NetApp CI', 'username': 'NetApp-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-30 16:24:28.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/test_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1714691-decimal-separators-in-locales-392c0c794c49c1c2.yaml', 'manila/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix issue with different decimal separators

An issue was discovered in the ZFSonLinux driver wherein on a system
set to have a locale where the decimal separator is not a period but
rather a comma the method translate_string_size_to_float() would fail
because it's regex to find sizes in strings did not account for any
other decimal separators other than periods.

This fix updates the regular expression to accept either a period or
a comma as a decimal separator in a size string.

Many thanks to Dr. Clemens Hardewig for reporting the original bug
and providing an updated regular expression.

Change-Id: I15da4aaff90814eed03816db013d6acc89ba2ee8
Closes-Bug: #1714691
(cherry picked from commit 8800e54f770c4c4a6f813a5ea72bb12316482d87)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with different decimal separators

An issue was discovered in the ZFSonLinux driver wherein on a system
set to have a locale where the decimal separator is not a period but
rather a comma the method translate_string_size_to_float() would fail
because it's regex to find sizes in strings did not account for any
other decimal separators other than periods.

This fix updates the regular expression to accept either a period or
a comma as a decimal separator in a size string.

Many thanks to Dr. Clemens Hardewig for reporting the original bug
and providing an updated regular expression.

Change-Id: I15da4aaff90814eed03816db013d6acc89ba2ee8
Closes-Bug: #1714691
(cherry picked from commit 8800e54f770c4c4a6f813a5ea72bb12316482d87)

subject: Enable longer Keystone token life
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-23 15:11:54.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'Enable longer Keystone token life

The devstack plugin sets a 3 hour Keystone token life
but Keystone is already running when this configuration change
is called so Keystone still runs with the default for the tests.

Add a restart of Keystone to enable the longer life.

Change-Id: Ie340b1c0b56652fc9ca4c0981468363c1be9fb25
'}]
commit_message:
Enable longer Keystone token life

The devstack plugin sets a 3 hour Keystone token life
but Keystone is already running when this configuration change
is called so Keystone still runs with the default for the tests.

Add a restart of Keystone to enable the longer life.

Change-Id: Ie340b1c0b56652fc9ca4c0981468363c1be9fb25

commit_message:
[reno] Update ironic-dbsync's check object version

This updates the release note pertaining to ironic-dbsync's
check of the object versions, to be explicit that these are the
database records that correspond to the IronicObjects.

This is a follow up to 6a91b38ca48eea2892a5a82b4369f1f9b277d019.

Change-Id: I1e2b3dc60529551746a0c7a258e5ce3cf509f59f

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-09-29 15:15:30.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py'], 'message': 'Dynamically determine SSL version in unit tests

KMIP by default tries to use PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2, but not all systems that
run the unit tests necessarily have this.

Dynamically determine the version to use.

Change-Id: Ia13841b3547332d6d5044b446b073dc2394bb8fb
'}]
commit_message:
Dynamically determine SSL version in unit tests

KMIP by default tries to use PROTOCOL_TLSv1_2, but not all systems that
run the unit tests necessarily have this.

Dynamically determine the version to use.

Change-Id: Ia13841b3547332d6d5044b446b073dc2394bb8fb

commit_message:
Move ironic legacy jobs into the ironic tree

This patch moves the legacy ironic CI jobs into the ironic tree instead
of storing them in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs to give us
control as we migrate the legacy jobs to the new ansible roles.

This also removes branch specifics from project.yaml, leaving only the
jobs we need to run on current release.

Change-Id: Ib728fadbdab2eb9f1ba5112297a32dbdbfd1d5fd
(cherry picked from commit 4b37c29b5e180d68e744e8114e2f414023d1376a)

commit_message:
Auto-generate sample config file

This PS auto-generates the sample config file using
oslo-config-generator which is how every project should reliably
produce a config file.

In addition, the Patrole documentation was updated to link to the
generated config file, so that the documentation accurately
shows config options.

Change-Id: Ib3c39084b4c2b5a0078d1293d882cf9a9050b29b
Closes-Bug: #1709490

commit_message:
rp: remove _HasAResourceProvider mixin

The _HasAResourceProvider mixin is no longer needed since the results
of AllocationList.get_all_by_XXX() and InventoryList.get_all_by_XXX()
have been modified to manually construct the Allocation and Inventory
POD objects using optimized non-ORM queries, so removing the mixin.

blueprint: de-orm-resource-providers

Change-Id: I1cc50c2e2501fef1fe8bad8451f833380371def8

subject: Change QoS configuration manual
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-10-27 22:54:50.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/config-qos.rst'], 'message': "Change QoS configuration manual

As [1] shows, the controller node hosts the Neutron server but
also agents like L3 and DHCP which require also OVS or LinuxBridge
agent to be running on it.
To enable QoS is required to enable the 'service_plugins' and
the 'extension_drivers', along with the agent section in the plugin
config if the agent is running on this host.

In the network node and the compute node only the agent
'extensions' configuration is needed to enable QoS
on the agent.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/networking/architecture.html

Closes-Bug: #1720077

Change-Id: I14128aabe0a9209c31a1bd4c76eed1182364ccdf
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <slawek@kaplonski.pl>
"}]
commit_message:
Change QoS configuration manual

As [1] shows, the controller node hosts the Neutron server but
also agents like L3 and DHCP which require also OVS or LinuxBridge
agent to be running on it.
To enable QoS is required to enable the 'service_plugins' and
the 'extension_drivers', along with the agent section in the plugin
config if the agent is running on this host.

In the network node and the compute node only the agent
'extensions' configuration is needed to enable QoS
on the agent.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/security-guide/networking/architecture.html

Closes-Bug: #1720077

Change-Id: I14128aabe0a9209c31a1bd4c76eed1182364ccdf
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <slawek@kaplonski.pl>

commit_message:
Bump MAX version of client to 3.45

Adding a shared_targets field to Volumes in Cinder.  This doesn't
require any changes in the client, however we do need to bump the
MAX MV support value.

Show volumes now returns two new fields that will be displayed in
the show command:
    shared_targets: <True|False>
    backend_name:  <backend-name-of-storage-device>

Change-Id: Ie1291f90756c3752de562f022126af2f6b3e0637

This change automatically inserts the DockerInsecureRegistryAddress
parameter into the containers image environment file if the registry
is reachable and unencrypted.

This eliminates a documented manual step, which is also required

commit_message:
Autodetect insecure registry in container image prepare

This change automatically inserts the DockerInsecureRegistryAddress
parameter into the containers image environment file if the registry
is reachable and unencrypted.

This eliminates a documented manual step, which is also required
throughout CI. It has been done in tripleoclient so that it can be
backported. The dedicated workflow for
blueprint container-prepare-workflow will have its own insecure
detection.

Change-Id: I74586145c222921880402cec92bbaa5f10e8b972
Closes-Bug: #1722632

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 360, 'name': 'Dan Prince', 'email': 'dprince@redhat.com', 'username': 'dan-prince'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6772, 'name': 'Stephen Gordon', 'email': 'sgordon@redhat.com', 'username': 'sgordon'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 14831, 'name': 'Tomofumi Hayashi', 'email': 'tohayash@redhat.com', 'username': 's1061123'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 15335, 'name': 'Vijay Chundury', 'email': 'vchundur@redhat.com', 'username': 'vijaychundury'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 21151, 'name': 'zenghui.shi', 'email': 'zshi@redhat.com', 'username': 'zshi'}, {'_account_id': 21908, 'name': 'Frank Zdarsky', 'email': 'fzdarsky@redhat.com', 'username': 'fzdarsky'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23811, 'name': 'Oliver Walsh', 'email': 'owalsh@redhat.com', 'username': 'owalsh'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-10-05 20:16:32.000000000', 'files': ['specs/queens/tripleo-ptp.rst'], 'message': 'Tripleo PTP (Precision Time Protocol) support

This spec introduces support for a time synchronization
method called PTP (defined in the IEEE 1588-2008) which
provides better time accuracy than NTP in general. With
hardware timestamping support on the host, PTP can
achieve clock accuracy in the sub-microsecond range,
making it suitable for measurement and control systems.

Change-Id: I3e5cc2e854eb8e0374e36640816dcdb5fc8a773f
'}]
commit_message:
Tripleo PTP (Precision Time Protocol) support

This spec introduces support for a time synchronization
method called PTP (defined in the IEEE 1588-2008) which
provides better time accuracy than NTP in general. With
hardware timestamping support on the host, PTP can
achieve clock accuracy in the sub-microsecond range,
making it suitable for measurement and control systems.

Change-Id: I3e5cc2e854eb8e0374e36640816dcdb5fc8a773f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-26 21:24:22.000000000', 'files': ['manila/tests/test_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/bug-1714691-decimal-separators-in-locales-392c0c794c49c1c2.yaml', 'manila/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix issue with different decimal separators

An issue was discovered in the ZFSonLinux driver wherein on a system
set to have a locale where the decimal separator is not a period but
rather a comma the method translate_string_size_to_float() would fail
because it's regex to find sizes in strings did not account for any
other decimal separators other than periods.

This fix updates the regular expression to accept either a period or
a comma as a decimal separator in a size string.

Many thanks to Dr. Clemens Hardewig for reporting the original bug
and providing an updated regular expression.

Change-Id: I15da4aaff90814eed03816db013d6acc89ba2ee8
Closes-Bug: #1714691
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with different decimal separators

An issue was discovered in the ZFSonLinux driver wherein on a system
set to have a locale where the decimal separator is not a period but
rather a comma the method translate_string_size_to_float() would fail
because it's regex to find sizes in strings did not account for any
other decimal separators other than periods.

This fix updates the regular expression to accept either a period or
a comma as a decimal separator in a size string.

Many thanks to Dr. Clemens Hardewig for reporting the original bug
and providing an updated regular expression.

Change-Id: I15da4aaff90814eed03816db013d6acc89ba2ee8
Closes-Bug: #1714691

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-07-12 20:01:38.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/v2/attributes.py', 'neutron/tests/tools.py'], 'message': "shim RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP from neutron-lib

neutron-lib now contains the rehomed API attributes.
As the usage of RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP is fairly wide-spread
[1] this patch shims neutron's attribute map to use lib's allowing
consumers to move to lib's map without worry of syncing with this patch.
A subsequent patch will move neutron over to lib's attribute map.
Once consumers have moved over to lib for the RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP
we can come back and remove the shim herein.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP

Change-Id: If0c010e9910d1256417162a059d1fdace31c290a
"}]
commit_message:
shim RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP from neutron-lib

neutron-lib now contains the rehomed API attributes.
As the usage of RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP is fairly wide-spread
[1] this patch shims neutron's attribute map to use lib's allowing
consumers to move to lib's map without worry of syncing with this patch.
A subsequent patch will move neutron over to lib's attribute map.
Once consumers have moved over to lib for the RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP
we can come back and remove the shim herein.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP

Change-Id: If0c010e9910d1256417162a059d1fdace31c290a

commit_message:
use RESOURCES from neutron-lib

Patch If0c010e9910d1256417162a059d1fdace31c290a already shimmed neutron
for using neutron-lib RESOURCES map. This patch builds upon the shim
and replaces all neutron's uses of RESOURCE_ATTRIBUTE_MAP with
neutron-lib's RESOURCES map.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I33bcd4a88083ca97941b60dbf59309e121dff1a1

commit_message:
Reference architecture: common bits

This change introduces the layout of the future reference architecture
guide. It also introduces common ideas and considerations, to avoid
repeating them for each provided architecture.

commit_message:
ironic-dbsync: check object versions

Now that we have rolling upgrades and the version column was
added and populated in the Pike release, we can add checks to
make sure the versions of objects in the DB are compatible
with this ironic release, before ironic-dbsync's upgrade or
online_data_migrations does its work. These ironic-dbsync
calls are made as part of upgrading to this (Queens) release.

Change-Id: I68758f8a29d483f5c0a7439fa2ea2962b2eb4124
Partial-Bug: #1708243

commit_message:
Clean up jinja2 templates on conditional checks

Starting in Ansible 2.3, jinja2 templates with conditionals were
no longer supported. Users should have always directly stated the
variables and not treated it as a string of jinja2 text to be
expanded.

In order to support newer ansible versions, the conditionals have
been updated accordingly.

Change-Id: Ib74c1783241436258dc0bd52a8a6990c00785775

commit_message:
Revert "Set meta container-attribute-target=host attribute"

This patch broke the containers scenario004 test because it relies on a
newer mariadb container than has actually passed CI at this time.

To revert this revert, we need to make sure we test
scenario004-containers against that patch.

This reverts commit 6bcb011723ad7b75f18914c887dc4fa4bad4d620.

Closes-Bug: 1721497

Change-Id: I34c7c388eed94db1735c45e26661a0af8cdce8e9

subject: apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-13 05:51:50.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'spec/classes/ceilometer_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': "apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
have this limitation.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock

Change-Id: I2e07baf0cb99980a4207ca73204d242e9913f44c
"}]
commit_message:
apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
have this limitation.

[1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock

Change-Id: I2e07baf0cb99980a4207ca73204d242e9913f44c

commit_message:
Move pip_install deployment

This patch adds the pip_install role deployment into it's own
playbook. This will allow us to remove the meta-dependency for
the pip_install role in many of the independent role
repositories. That should save time in the gate and for
deployers.

Change-Id: Ic207dd1166088177fcee03d6b1729350884d1d7c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-10-26 09:22:35.000000000', 'files': ['tacker/db/nfvo/vnffg_db.py'], 'message': '[Bug-Fix] Update VNFFG leaves db in error state

Currently in tacker there is no support for updating a chain or
a classifier. So if anyone was trying to update a chain through
the vnffg-update command of the tackerclient a NotImplementedError
was raising and that was leaving the whole tacker ecosystem in an error
state.

That was happening because some objects in the database was in an status
ERROR and some other in a status PENDING_UPDATE.

With this patch we are setting all the objects in the database in a
ERROR status therefore the user can delete the failed VNFFG without
erasing the whole tacker database.

Closes-Bug: #1724809

Change-Id: I2c399a33055ccce41be941eca0bee52508399fd7
Signed-off-by: Dimitrios Markou <mardim@intracom-telecom.com>
'}]
commit_message:
[Bug-Fix] Update VNFFG leaves db in error state

Currently in tacker there is no support for updating a chain or
a classifier. So if anyone was trying to update a chain through
the vnffg-update command of the tackerclient a NotImplementedError
was raising and that was leaving the whole tacker ecosystem in an error
state.

That was happening because some objects in the database was in an status
ERROR and some other in a status PENDING_UPDATE.

With this patch we are setting all the objects in the database in a
ERROR status therefore the user can delete the failed VNFFG without
erasing the whole tacker database.

Closes-Bug: #1724809

Change-Id: I2c399a33055ccce41be941eca0bee52508399fd7
Signed-off-by: Dimitrios Markou <mardim@intracom-telecom.com>

commit_message:
Fix beaker tests to use openstack_integration for RabbitMQ

The RabbitMQ acceptance tests used to be pointing towards the Kilo
repos.  This patch addresses it so that it leverages the Puppet
OpenStack integration manifests instead.

Change-Id: I3a647184141f5d66f212ee91d4cf36e8547c7517
(cherry picked from commit 735c6641f02da78033eb6aa5e0458b61046ec73b)

commit_message:
Fix endpoint examples in api-ref

Endpoints have no name property[1] so specifying one in an update
request is incorrect, nor should we expect one in response to a create.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/keystone/tree/keystone/catalog/schema.py?h=12.0.0#n90

Change-Id: I94ae15ef77872523920ed0b43fe5e09755766fb5

subject: Resolve deployment issues with multi-node swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-27 05:09:23.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Resolve deployment issues with multi-node swift

Swift fails to deploy when using >1 storage node. The fact `need_sync`
was being set using information from ansible_local in an effort to
support rolling uprades sometime in the future. Sadly this variable
causes storage nodes to be removed from the key sync which results in a
failed build.  The task to define the `need_sync` fact has been
commented out and noted. If we decide serialized rolling uprades are
required for swift we can revisit this however until then we need to
remove this constraint and ensure we're allowing successfule deployments
and upgrades of swift.

Change-Id: Ia8697285baa714ab345381b28574a222c5881954
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Resolve deployment issues with multi-node swift

Swift fails to deploy when using >1 storage node. The fact `need_sync`
was being set using information from ansible_local in an effort to
support rolling uprades sometime in the future. Sadly this variable
causes storage nodes to be removed from the key sync which results in a
failed build.  The task to define the `need_sync` fact has been
commented out and noted. If we decide serialized rolling uprades are
required for swift we can revisit this however until then we need to
remove this constraint and ensure we're allowing successfule deployments
and upgrades of swift.

Change-Id: Ia8697285baa714ab345381b28574a222c5881954
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Don't run sync in upgrades
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-07-05 15:10:01.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Don't run sync in upgrades

When running a rolling upgrade, each swift node is addressed
individually. This can result in undefined variables when a node doesn't
have the necessary SSH and ring information.

For minor upgrades, these changes are not necessary. They are only
necessary in fresh installs, or modifying storage capacity. Thus, this
patch checks to see if it's a new install (no swift venv_tag previously
defined) or it's the same version (current venv tag matches the previous
one) and only does syncs in those cases.

Change-Id: Ice3b4526609f5a5fd4472c8408de9ed08aea29e6
"}]
commit_message:
Don't run sync in upgrades

When running a rolling upgrade, each swift node is addressed
individually. This can result in undefined variables when a node doesn't
have the necessary SSH and ring information.

For minor upgrades, these changes are not necessary. They are only
necessary in fresh installs, or modifying storage capacity. Thus, this
patch checks to see if it's a new install (no swift venv_tag previously
defined) or it's the same version (current venv tag matches the previous
one) and only does syncs in those cases.

Change-Id: Ice3b4526609f5a5fd4472c8408de9ed08aea29e6

causes storage nodes to be removed from the key sync which results in a
failed build.  The task to define the `need_sync` fact has been

remove this constraint and ensure we're allowing successfule deployments

commit_message:
Resolve deployment issues with multi-node swift

Swift fails to deploy when using >1 storage node. The fact `need_sync`
was being set using information from ansible_local in an effort to
support rolling uprades sometime in the future. Sadly this variable
causes storage nodes to be removed from the key sync which results in a
failed build.  The task to define the `need_sync` fact has been
commented out and noted. If we decide serialized rolling uprades are
required for swift we can revisit this however until then we need to
remove this constraint and ensure we're allowing successfule deployments
and upgrades of swift.

Change-Id: Ia8697285baa714ab345381b28574a222c5881954
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use generic user for both zuul v2 and v3

Zuul v2 uses 'jenkins' as user, but Zuul v3 uses 'zuul'.
Using $USER solves it for both cases.

Change-Id: I42c3328bf7ce5dbb745eb21954bc5528a6befed5

commit_message:
Support  multiprocessing parallel evaluation of Vitrage templates.

Per event template matching runs in parallel,
using N EvaluatorWorkers each holding a copy of the graph,
and executing different templates.

Change-Id: I9d777fde1ea2bc3155c3eca8a30877aedd669081
Depends-On: I2d1e31e386a2576b3a44ec5b8e15dc49d2a474d3
Implements: blueprint parallel-evaluation

commit_message:
Fix theme rendering for kilo

Set WEBROOT in openstack-dashboard's local_settings.py to the value
of webroot from the charm's config (see config.yaml).

Add /horizon/static alias to apache2 config in addition to /static
to cover both paths to static resources.

Change-Id: I29a156d322bac91ca02fb0f08f291fc805e59110
Closes-Bug: #1728086

commit_message:
DNM Test fullstack test only with 1 worker

We want to check how long it would take for fullstack tests
to finish only with 1 worker.
As tests will work one by one it can be solution/workaround
e.g. for issue with race condition for processing trunk
ports and bridges by Openvswitch agents.

Depends-On: Ieb2b8916d4cdbb3b7e6a953c827b176f2217a42f
Depends-On: Ic01086dd596a80b461a5cc9884536c48468340e9

Change-Id: Icca6125d06225624be774521b58e715ad814eabf

subject: Make charms.ceph fully py2/py3 compatible
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-30 12:03:00.000000000', 'files': ['ceph/broker.py', 'unit_tests/test_utils.py', 'setup.py', 'ceph/crush_utils.py', 'ceph/utils.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Make charms.ceph fully py2/py3 compatible

These changes make the charms.ceph library suitable for both the
old-stable Python 2 charms and the (to be) updates Python 3 only charms.
Avoided use of six by using str() with the decode('UTF-8') function to
allow the library to be used with both Py2 and Py3.  The str(...)
coercions can be removed at a later date when the library no longer
needs to be synced to Py2 versions of the ceph-* charms.

Change-Id: I416053439444bf4cf8945d1fe96643f9ed0f05f4
"}]
commit_message:
Make charms.ceph fully py2/py3 compatible

These changes make the charms.ceph library suitable for both the
old-stable Python 2 charms and the (to be) updates Python 3 only charms.
Avoided use of six by using str() with the decode('UTF-8') function to
allow the library to be used with both Py2 and Py3.  The str(...)
coercions can be removed at a later date when the library no longer
needs to be synced to Py2 versions of the ceph-* charms.

Change-Id: I416053439444bf4cf8945d1fe96643f9ed0f05f4

commit_message:
Change parent to parent_name in lsp_add

Since **columns is accepted and the column name that 'parent'
refers to is actually 'parent_name', passing 'parent_name' in
**columns doesn't work. This changes the argument parent to match
the actual column name.

Change-Id: I2373015677c73a0da85bd44b3c5c117c3345302f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-27 07:33:23.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/memcached.yaml'], 'message': "persist memcached logs in /var/log/containers/memcached/memcached.log

We used to bind-mount /var/log/memcached.log, but this resulted in the
file being createdin the memcached container as a directory, since this
file didn't exist.

This commit takes the approach of other containers and gets the logs to
a memcached directory in /var/log/containers.

Closes-Bug: #1720183
"}]
commit_message:
persist memcached logs in /var/log/containers/memcached/memcached.log

We used to bind-mount /var/log/memcached.log, but this resulted in the
file being createdin the memcached container as a directory, since this
file didn't exist.

This commit takes the approach of other containers and gets the logs to
a memcached directory in /var/log/containers.

Change-Id: I926b65fa557ad56b4faa2be34452b58f7b01247a
Closes-Bug: #1720183

commit_message:
Set verbosity by default for memcached

This sets of one level of verbosity for memcached by default. This
allows us to see any errors or warnings in the logs.

Change-Id: Icc6f56c9e0ee6100286d07c8b6660a08baabb241
Related-Bug: #1720183

commit_message:
DNM: try possible fix to missing config drive setting

The force_config_drive setting is apparently not making it's way into
the nova configuration. This change aligns with other service templates
that need to configure other services.

Change-Id: I595f89dbec86425d678978ab4e3528799dbdfebc

subject: use Newton sha's for cross repo versions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-26 21:17:10.000000000', 'files': ['test-vars.yml'], 'message': "use Newton sha's for cross repo versions

Newton has started removing the stable/newton branch across several
projects. To ensure we're not breaking the newton gate as we work
through the last few weeks of this release, this change modifies the
checkout versions of our pinned projects to use the latest stable SHA.

Change-Id: Ia3009901d63068b379f22d587efcba996f47b844
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
use Newton sha's for cross repo versions

Newton has started removing the stable/newton branch across several
projects. To ensure we're not breaking the newton gate as we work
through the last few weeks of this release, this change modifies the
checkout versions of our pinned projects to use the latest stable SHA.

Change-Id: Ia3009901d63068b379f22d587efcba996f47b844
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add image_member_quota to Glance API configuration

Allow the configuration of image_member_quota
in Glance API. This error blocks the ability
of sharing images if the default value (128)
is reached.

Change-Id: Id4bdf7f755f5b595ccd912f083d76bfdfac5bd06
Closes-bug: 1724879

This reverts commit fd4db8ea906d60a21b44205f796c769eeb51a764.
The playbook used here needs to be in every repo calling that job
(which is all our branches and all our repos).

I suggest we revert it until alll the other zuul v3 changes are settled.
We can then take a more organized approach.

Change-Id: I8ba967af69311fc0684635462d27cdc03728ca81
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Move log collection to 'post' stage"

This reverts commit fd4db8ea906d60a21b44205f796c769eeb51a764.
The playbook used here needs to be in every repo calling that job
(which is all our branches and all our repos).

I suggest we revert it until alll the other zuul v3 changes are settled.
We can then take a more organized approach.

Change-Id: I8ba967af69311fc0684635462d27cdc03728ca81

commit_message:
Switch to use keystone v3

Keystone v2 api's are removed in [1], so it's required
to use keystone v3 otherwise all requests fallbacks to
keystone v2.0 and fails.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499783/

Change-Id: I0464d6b37c3e269d3bdc1eb5034ec751f977b6a8
Closes-Bug: #1723838

subject: [WIP] [Qos] Fix cleaning of ingress bandwidth limit in ovs agent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-25 13:21:48.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/extension_drivers/qos_driver.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/extension_drivers/test_qos_driver.py'], 'message': '[WIP] [Qos] Fix cleaning of ingress bandwidth limit in ovs agent

When e.g. Nova deletes port with attached QoS policy, Neutron
calls QoS extension driver methods to delete QoS rules from this port.
In case if vif_port not exists anymore driver is just doing nothing.
This is fine for egress bandwidth limit as it is configured directly
on vif_port in OVS.
For ingress bw limit however it's uses additional records in Openvswitch
database: qos and queue. Those records wasn't cleaned in such case.

This patch changes id which is configured in "external_ids" of qos and
queue records from port_name to port_id.
Id of port is known even during port deletion and thanks to that
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Icdfe507c26c469e56492cbf03162c3ef9182eca7
Closes-Bug: #1726732
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] [Qos] Fix cleaning of ingress bandwidth limit in ovs agent

When e.g. Nova deletes port with attached QoS policy, Neutron
calls QoS extension driver methods to delete QoS rules from this port.
In case if vif_port not exists anymore driver is just doing nothing.
This is fine for egress bandwidth limit as it is configured directly
on vif_port in OVS.
For ingress bw limit however it's uses additional records in Openvswitch
database: qos and queue. Those records wasn't cleaned in such case.

This patch changes id which is configured in "external_ids" of qos and
queue records from port_name to port_id.
Id of port is known even during port deletion and thanks to that
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Icdfe507c26c469e56492cbf03162c3ef9182eca7
Closes-Bug: #1726732

subject: Use new zuul v3 git src location
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-25 10:02:13.000000000', 'files': ['test-vars.yml'], 'message': "Use new zuul v3 git src location

Previously we used a complex job definition to make sure
that the appropriate git clones for cross-repo testing
were in place. Now we just used the same location where
zuul v3 puts the git sources automatically when a
cross-repo test is done.

This ensures that our cross-repo tests do what they're
supposed to and that we're using the same default location
as the rest of openstack's tests, making it more intuitive.

Change-Id: Ia5ab6aa43f912b3cb4adf98154cd3da12688c2e0
"}]
commit_message:
Use new zuul v3 git src location

Previously we used a complex job definition to make sure
that the appropriate git clones for cross-repo testing
were in place. Now we just used the same location where
zuul v3 puts the git sources automatically when a
cross-repo test is done.

This ensures that our cross-repo tests do what they're
supposed to and that we're using the same default location
as the rest of openstack's tests, making it more intuitive.

Change-Id: Ia5ab6aa43f912b3cb4adf98154cd3da12688c2e0

commit_message:
Revert "update constraint for oslo.serialization to new release 2.21.2"

The update to 2.21.1 breaks glance unit tests:

FAIL: glance.tests.unit.v1.test_registry_api.TestRegistryAPI.test_update_all_image_members
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "glance/tests/unit/v1/test_registry_api.py", line 1629, in test_update_all_image_members
    content_type='json')
  File "glance/tests/utils.py", line 564, in get_api_response_ext
    self.assertEqual(res.status_int, http_resp)
  File "/data/dmueller/src/Cloud/glance/.tox/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 411, in assertEqual
    self.assertThat(observed, matcher, message)
  File "/data/dmueller/src/Cloud/glance/.tox/venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/testtools/testcase.py", line 498, in assertThat
    raise mismatch_error
testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: 200 != 204

Related-Bug: #1728368

This reverts commit 47206e21375ddd6a33c4b1e5d65d95976a73d70a.

Also, set tox_install_siblings=false temporarily due to a bug
in tox_siblings which is causing incorrect versions to be
installed.

commit_message:
Support Kubernetes as VIM in Tacker

This spec proposes supporting containerized VNF in Tacker using
Kubernetes as VIM.

By default, Tacker has only OpenStack as VIM. Kubernetes is one
platform to orchestration containers. This spec focuses on CRUD
Kubernetes VIM in Tacker.

blueprint: kubernetes-as-vim

Change-Id: I7fa57515a80a6f8a424cbf1c388ac025e308ec80
Co-Authored-By: Janki Chhatbar <jchhatba@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Trinath Somanchi <trinath.somanchi@nxp.com>
Co-Authored-By: Xuan Jia <jiaxuan@chinamobile.com>

subject: Remove check flat network type task in ironic pre-check.yml
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-20 08:17:04.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/ironic/tasks/precheck.yml'], 'message': 'Remove check flat network type task in ironic pre-check.yml

flat network type is not mandatory. There are two cases,

1. ironic with flat network: we can use neutron vlan network to
   provision baremetal nodes, as long as the interface of the baremetal
   nodes are configured to use the same vlan.

2. ironic with neutron network: all provision and cleaning_network can
   be vlan type and no flat is needed at all.

So we should remove the task.

Change-Id: I176ded6d2a8b14e350f665f63bc37eb488d32679
Closes-Bug: #1725170
'}]
commit_message:
Remove check flat network type task in ironic pre-check.yml

flat network type is not mandatory. There are two cases,

1. ironic with flat network: we can use neutron vlan network to
   provision baremetal nodes, as long as the interface of the baremetal
   nodes are configured to use the same vlan.

2. ironic with neutron network: all provision and cleaning_network can
   be vlan type and no flat is needed at all.

So we should remove the task.

Change-Id: I176ded6d2a8b14e350f665f63bc37eb488d32679
Closes-Bug: #1725170

subject: build-releasenotes: Add language index to all files
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-07-11 12:36:55.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/include/build-releasenotes.sh'], 'message': 'build-releasenotes: Add language index to all files

Release notes files are usually not accessed through index.html
and release notes of individual releases are accessed directly
as they are linked from releases.openstack.org.

It is better to have language list for all release notes files
so that readers can easily find translated versions.

Change-Id: If69520d3875941a51b194723ecfe524adf802cad
'}]
commit_message:
build-releasenotes: Add language index to all files

Release notes files are usually not accessed through index.html
and release notes of individual releases are accessed directly
as they are linked from releases.openstack.org.

It is better to have language list for all release notes files
so that readers can easily find translated versions.

Change-Id: If69520d3875941a51b194723ecfe524adf802cad

commit_message:
Fix gate / add tempest job

The Zuul v3 conversion missed the
tempest-dsvm-neutron-src-python-troveclient job and the base
tempest job is running in its place and blocking the gate.

This adds the Zuul project config and the definition for the
missing tempest job.

Change-Id: I532776e2e23b1ab5a5c9ef2b0278489f04a1097f

subject: Added AddNetwork command to server
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-10-26 15:34:04.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/add-server-add-network-98ede8ff6079eb23.yaml', 'setup.cfg', 'openstackclient/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Added AddNetwork command to server

Currently, if users want to add another NIC to a running instance,
they need to (i) create a neutron port and (ii) add the port to the
server via teh AddPort command. It would be more convenient to have
a single command to achieve the equivalent.

Novaclient already support adding network to an instance via the
interface-attach command. This patch introduces a similar capability
in OSC.

Change-Id: Ia3e39c57ae7ecb96aae1b66adc52c289daccb6ec
'}]
commit_message:
Added AddNetwork command to server

Currently, if users want to add another NIC to a running instance,
they need to (i) create a neutron port and (ii) add the port to the
server via teh AddPort command. It would be more convenient to have
a single command to achieve the equivalent.

Novaclient already support adding network to an instance via the
interface-attach command. This patch introduces a similar capability
in OSC.

Change-Id: Ia3e39c57ae7ecb96aae1b66adc52c289daccb6ec

subject: Don't create client for help and bash completion
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-27 10:57:16.000000000', 'files': ['mistralclient/shell.py', 'mistralclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py'], 'message': "Don't create client for help and bash completion

Currently when we need a help, client object is created
and authentication is performed. This is completely useless
and leads to unnecessary actions in the background.

This patch:
1. Prevents creation of client object (and therefore
authentication) for help or bash-completion commands.
2. Removes a workaround from keystone auth module that disables
sending requests to the server if help or bash-completion
commands are executing.
3. Adds related unit tests.

Change-Id: Ia26d7f4e56f5ef3ae0ac5e94e8e77d1a78f8829e
Closes-bug: #1720795
(cherry picked from commit d9da161c16bc524d4e1d64f09fa2d857cbcf4537)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't create client for help and bash completion

Currently when we need a help, client object is created
and authentication is performed. This is completely useless
and leads to unnecessary actions in the background.

This patch:
1. Prevents creation of client object (and therefore
authentication) for help or bash-completion commands.
2. Removes a workaround from keystone auth module that disables
sending requests to the server if help or bash-completion
commands are executing.
3. Adds related unit tests.

Change-Id: Ia26d7f4e56f5ef3ae0ac5e94e8e77d1a78f8829e
Closes-bug: #1720795
(cherry picked from commit d9da161c16bc524d4e1d64f09fa2d857cbcf4537)

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I358a4ee4d7faed68e449592480cb5d8fafa70cd1

Counting on just job success is not enough to report success to the dlrn
api.
We need to be sure images are uploaded before reporting, which needs to
be done elsewhere

Related-Bug: #1724093
Change-Id: I625395e590ea3db2e17abb27e021832dafe553fb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dlrnapi report at the end of the run

Counting on just job success is not enough to report success to the dlrn
api.
We need to be sure images are uploaded before reporting, which needs to
be done elsewhere

Related-Bug: #1724093
Change-Id: I625395e590ea3db2e17abb27e021832dafe553fb

subject: Switch to use keystone v3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-19 07:32:27.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/backend/swift.pp'], 'message': "Switch to use keystone v3

Keystone v2 api's are removed in [1], so it's required
to use keystone v3 otherwise all requests fallbacks to
keystone v2.0 and fails.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499783/

Change-Id: Ifdf1493a1adf3384c7ccba78c1ed7b7710f83d40
Closes-Bug: #1723838
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to use keystone v3

Keystone v2 api's are removed in [1], so it's required
to use keystone v3 otherwise all requests fallbacks to
keystone v2.0 and fails.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/499783/

Change-Id: Ifdf1493a1adf3384c7ccba78c1ed7b7710f83d40
Closes-Bug: #1723838

commit_message:
Fail on curl error when setting up repo

If the repo raises an error, there is no reason to be silent, setup will
fail later on. Let's fail explicitely when curl is called.

Change-Id: Ief5b319082a90b45b912ae3efcfbe2d2e77906e0

commit_message:
EMC XtremIO driver does not honor create from snapshot volume size

In case the new volume from snapshot is larger than the created one,
resize the created volume.

Change-Id: Ia8ba3b6e44a4855fe728444dd3e9753391268a93
Closes-Bug: #1560650

commit_message:
neutron-dynamic-routing: Use releasenote and publish job template

The neutron-dynamic-routing is a part of neutron stadium so
it should use release-notes-jobs-neutron and publish-to-pypi-neutron
template so that avoids required-projects error.

commit_message:
Update zuul-cloner dependencies for OpenStack-Helm projects

OpenStack-Helm-Addons repo hosting helm charts that have dependencies
on the main OpenStack-Helm repository's chart.  This patch set updates
the zuul-cloner dependencies so OSH-Addons can leverage charts in main
OSH project.

commit_message:
Add NFS test gate to OpenStack-Helm

Currently, all gates are using Ceph as its main persistent store.
This patch set adds NFS test to ensure OpenStack-Helm properly
support NFS as well as Ceph.

Change-Id: Iccd30618e58d7be3fa3010729687a41c3ec4e972

subject: Adds api-ref, docs, or installdocs statistics measures
revisions:
[{'number': 19, 'created': '2017-06-30 18:47:22.000000000', 'files': ['reviewstats/utils.py', '.gitignore', 'reviewstats/cmd/reviewers.py', 'README.rst', 'reviewstats/cmd/openreviews.py'], 'message': 'Adds api-ref, docs, or installdocs statistics measures

Use --apiref or --docs or --installdocs as arguments to view docs stats.

Ideally this report can be run to see which projects are doing
the most docs and api-ref changes and reviews. Would be helpful
to see which projects need docs contributors, which projects
need docs reviewers, which projects have healthy docs.

Change-Id: Ifce720a3c796d4f0a7d3dc6383f9dfb4384f7220
'}]
commit_message:
Adds api-ref, docs, or installdocs statistics measures

Use --apiref or --docs or --installdocs as arguments to view docs stats.

Ideally this report can be run to see which projects are doing
the most docs and api-ref changes and reviews. Would be helpful
to see which projects need docs contributors, which projects
need docs reviewers, which projects have healthy docs.

Change-Id: Ifce720a3c796d4f0a7d3dc6383f9dfb4384f7220

commit_message:
Don't install bindep-fallbacks with recommends turned on

bindeps should be exactly installed like advertised with no additional
optional packages being implicitely installed as well. This makes
it consistent with installations on other distributions and reduces
the install overhead greatly.

Change-Id: Ib789e53979da5ab7142a7cd452335e1b31e47ebd
